problem.markdown:
1. CD spectrometer can be operated in the following region of electromagnetic spectrum
() UV region only () Visible region only (x) Both UV and Visible regions () IR only
2. Circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopy measures differences in the absorption of left-handed polarized light versus right-handed polarized light which arise due to :
() Structural symmetry. (x) Structural asymmetry. () Both (a) and (b) () Absence of regular structure
3. CD spectrometer is useful in studying:
() Estimation of various secondary structural elements in proteins () Conformational changes in proteins (x) Both (a) and (b) () Determination of complete 3-D structure of proteins
4. CD spectrum of a protein is sensitive to the:
() Temperature () pH () Buffer type and concentration (x) All of the above
5. A CD spectrum can exhibit : () Positive peaks only () Negative peaks only (x) Both (a) and (b) () Neither positive nor Negative peaks
